a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of rural vs. urban population with electricity access, 2021
Having access to electricity is defined in international statistics as having an electricity source that can provide
very basic lighting, and charge a phone or power a radio for 4 hours per day.
Share of urban population with access
Share of rural population with access
Data source: Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024)
